name: NoTex.ch
tagline: An online text editor for reStructuredText, Markdown, LaTex and more!
body:
**NoTex.ch** helps you to write reports using the lightweight markup language *reStructuredText* aka **rST**. Once you've written your article or report, it can easily be translated to various formats like **PDF**, **HTML** or **LaTex**. To launch the application, use the following link:

***
[**Launch NoTex.ch**](https://notex.ch) will start the application.
***

## ReStructuredText

### Purpose
The rST markup is commonly used for technical documentation, e.g. for software libraries. However, reStructuredText is also very much suitable for other kinds of texts, like articles, reports or theses.

### Tutorial
There are many good primers, tutorials and references about rST, e.g. [rST Primer](http://sphinx.pocoo.org/rest.html) is quite a thorough introduction and [Quick reStructuredText](http://docutils.sourceforge.net/docs/user/rst/quickref.html) is a good reference.

### Miscellanea
NoTex' front-end has entirely been written with the [ExtJS](http://www.sencha.com/products/extjs3) JavaScript and the back-end with the [Flask](http://flask.pocoo.org) Python library.

***
[**Launch NoTex.ch**](https://notex.ch) will start the application.
***
